title: Digital Integrated Education Course for Remote Medical Clinical Skill Improvement: Linking Social and Healthcare Systems

context.prior_knowledge: Possession of basic clinical skills and medical job experience, with foundational understanding of healthcare systems and patient rights
context.additional_context: Conducted in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments, with projects linked to clinical practice. Includes case studies on improving healthcare accessibility to address regional health disparities.

learning_goals: Learners demonstrate basic clinical skills (e.g., blood pressure measurement, wound care) with 85% accuracy using remote video assessment tools while adhering to medical protocols and patient safety standards.

Learners collaboratively design problem-solving processes with peers and instructors via digital platforms, share ≥3 practical cases, and strengthen relationship-building competencies within healthcare systems.

Learners evaluate decision-making competencies for complex clinical scenarios (emergency/chronic conditions) using situation-based simulation modules grounded in the 4C-ID model, considering healthcare systems and cultural contexts.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
